column5: Sleded, Red Devil and I headed out to some Lake Erie canals to start the day looking for crappies and bluegills. When we met Red Devil at the spot he already had 4 crappies bucketed. The action was intense on the bluegills and the crappies were biting pretty good as well until about 2:30. We also got into some OOS bass surprisingly. That's gotta be a first for January open water fishing! Gotta love global warming!  Red Devil with an OOS bass:    The weather was perfect for BBQ'ing as we had BBQ elk burgers and ONIIOOONNNSSSS!!    Sleded was so full he could barely move. In fact, we thought he was dead so we had to call the police to make it an official crime scene.    The murder weapon:    While the police were investigating the murder, Red Devil and I got them to snap a pic of some of our fish.    Luckily Sleded was okay and we weren't charged for murder. As he woke up, he continued eating.    As we moved spots to a different canal after the BBQ I sat up in my redneck fishing throne and continued to slay the bluegill.    Then it was my shot at an OOS bass, and what a monster!    After that, Sleded and I moved on to the mighty Lynn in search of carp, but to our surprise there was nothing but panfish biting. Oh and an OOS trout .. lol        And then Sleded scored with the trophy fish of the day, the World's Greatest Sportfish - king of all fish - the rock bass.    It was an awesome day on the water and we can account that on the fact that the video camera battery died again! Can't wait to get back out.
Your something else Rich........and that's meant as a compliment  !!
LOL...you guys just kill me.  Always looks like you have fun out there.  Congrats on all the fish too!
That be some fine fun fishing there, Rich.  Great snaps, and commentary was hilarious as usual.  A gift it is.

Rich,great report like all reports on OFC you guys put a good sequence of pics up with tremendous "Light Side Of Life" facial expresssions which bring a compliment to your reports Keep it up Rich and Sleded
lol... Great Report... if you can't have fun fishing whats the point... Peace Ken

Not meaning to stir the pot or anything here... but isn't it illegal to fish within 25 yards of any structures (dams) that stop fish from migrating further upstream in Ontario? Sleded looks alittle too close in one of the pictures...  Nice fish either way...   Bojan
